unit_learning_outcomes.description: Review and critically evaluate diverse scientific literature and present your findings.

Acquire, analyse, and interpret research data and methods in a way suitable for
presentation to the scientific community.

Participate in the day-to-day running of a research group and the responsibilities in
research and collaborate in discussion centred around research ideas, methods, and
data.

Communicate advanced theoretical and practical knowledge of fields of contemporary
research.

assessments.description: Research proposal based on first research rotation.
Presentation of outcomes from first research rotation.
Conference proceeding on second research rotation topic.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is the first of two units facilitating research within the first year of the Masters of Research within the Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences. This unit focuses on providing a first hand experience of performing research and research communication. In this unit, you will become a member of several research groups under the supervision of a senior PhD candidate or post-doctoral staff member. Learning activities will include participation in research activities such as assisting in the acquisition, analysis and interpretation of data, participation in research group meetings and journal clubs, and practical experience in research communication. The immersive learning environment within the research activities will provide you with access to discipline-specific expertise, and you will be able to demonstrate the application of the theoretical knowledge obtained in your other learning activities. Through this unit you will develop skills as a researcher and research communicator.
data.title: Research Rotation 1
